description: From Portuguese alqueire, from Arabic الكَيْل‎ (al-kayl, “a measure”), from ك ي ل‎ (k y l).

entries.meaning: (historical) A traditional Portuguese unit of dry measure, equal to 13.1–19.3 liters in different 19th-century contexts.
(historical) A traditional Portuguese unit of land area, equal to 2–10 hectares in different locations.
